cs.AI, cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.CR, cs.SE. 

The paper deals with generating natural language justifications for decisions made by an agent based on norm-based reasoning. This involves using object-oriented temporal logic to specify rules that the agent must follow, and then answering factual and "why" questions about the agent's behavior. This suggests that the paper is likely to be relevant to the fields of artificial intelligence (cs.AI), computational linguistics (cs.CL), and machine learning (cs.LG), as these are all areas that deal with developing systems that can reason and communicate in natural language. Additionally, the paper may be relevant to the field of computer security (cs.CR), as it deals with ensuring that agents follow specified rules. Finally, the paper may be relevant to the field of software engineering (cs.SE), as it involves developing a system for generating natural language explanations of software behavior.
